definition: Lee Kuan Yew (1923-2015), founding father of modern Singapore, prime minister 1959-1990
splendor shines on the family's door (idiom)/fig. to bring honor to one's family

sentences.english: Li Guangyao’s mother also invests her hopes in the next generation.
sentences.chinese: 李光耀的媽媽也在她的下一代上投資着她自己的夢想。

sentences.english: He was obedient and faithful, always wishing to honour and protect his master.
sentences.chinese: 他還很忠誠聽話，總希望保護老師，光耀師門。

sentences.english: Like Wang Tingting, Guangyao lives at Wang Zhi's foster centre.
sentences.chinese: 和王婷婷一樣，光耀也託付給了王志的託管中心。

sentences.english: The picture would have done honour to Athens in the age of Pericles.
sentences.chinese: 這幅畫足以光耀伯里克利時代的雅典人”。

sentences.english: The Eiffel Tower and the Hotel des Invalides are illuminated at dusk with in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎的埃菲爾鐵塔和榮平易近院在夜幕中光耀精明。

sentences.english: Lee Kuan Yew still likes to jerk the strings backstage in Singapore.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡的李光耀依然喜歡在幕後操縱大局。

sentences.english: Lee Kuan -yew contemplates retiring with a hand on the helm .
sentences.chinese: 李光耀打算退位而依然聽政。

sentences.english: With the foam of the berry-red wine I will bathe and brighten my laughter.
sentences.chinese: 以紅果酒的泡沫來沐浴，使我歡笑發出光耀。

sentences.english: Mr. Zhu said that more details are also needed on the insurance scheme.
sentences.chinese: 朱光耀說，還需要了解更多的有關保險方案的詳情。

sentences.english: True love is as luminous as the dawn and as silent as the tomb.
sentences.chinese: 愛情是和黎明一樣光耀，和墳墓一樣沉寂的。

sentences.english: But you are aware of a richness, a shimmering effect, a depth.
sentences.chinese: 但是你意識到一種豐富，光耀的效果，一種深度。

sentences.english: Li Guangyao's mother also invests her hopes in the next generation.
sentences.chinese: 李光耀的媽媽也在她的下一代上投資着她自己的夢想。

sentences.english: Because the husband is off the rails, yu Xiaojiang divorces with Liu Guangyao.
sentences.chinese: 由於丈夫出軌，於小強跟劉光耀離婚。
直至2011年，李光耀辭去“內閣資政”一職。
比王冠的星星更加光耀。

sentences.english: Kuan Yew is something of an oddity.
sentences.chinese: 李光耀的出現是個異數。

definition: to dazzle/to brighten up (a room etc)
(of the sunlight) to bathe all things/to shine gloriously
